content.description: Start down and right on a good hold above the arête. Traverse left under a log on good holds, and top out as for Timber.
content.location: It is on the uphill side of the Timber Boulder.

content.description: Start with a left hand crimp and your right hand on a low sidepull. Hold the core, and catch another crimp (next to left hand) with your right hand. Throw to the lip, and top out.
content.location: It is on the uphill side of the boulder towards the left side of the face.

content.description: Start the downhill side of the arête for Timber Traverse. Traverse the lip right and upwards to the high point, and make some burly moves over the top for the mantel. There is great movement on this one.
content.protection: Crashpads and a spotter. The landing is sloped downhill.
content.location: It is on the left arete when looking uphill at the boulder.

content.description: Timber Boulder is a decent-sized boulder towards the top of the talus field with a couple easy lines, a moderate, and a hard line still yet to be climbed (as far as I know).
